intro: Escobariopsis humboldtii, commonly known as the Humboldt's broom. It is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Peru. This species belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the coastline, where it thrives in salty and windy conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are adapted for wind pollination, which is common in its arid and coastal habitat.
